trans-unit.source: Provides a common implementation of members for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListBox"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox"></xref> classes.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> class provides implementations of common elements for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> controls.

The following properties are of primary concern to users of a data-bound <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>: <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> class.
Gets a value indicating whether the list enables selection of list items.
`true` if the list enables list item selection; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> associated with this control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataManager%2A> property is valid if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property is set.
If this is not a data-bound control, the default is `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.CurrencyManager"></xref> associated with this control.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets the data source for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
There are two ways to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListBox> controls.
For example, you can add objects to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.ObjectCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also add objects to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> properties to fill the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox>.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property is set, a user cannot modify the items collection.
If setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> property causes the data source to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSourceChanged> event is raised.
If setting this property causes the data member to change, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMemberChanged> event is raised.
When you set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource%2A> to `null`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> is set to an empty string ("").

An object that implements the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> interfaces, such as a <xref href="System.Data.DataSet"></xref> or an <xref href="System.Array"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
The assigned value does not implement the <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> interfaces.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource"></xref> changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the property to display for this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
The controls that inherit from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> can display diverse types of objects.

If the specified property does not exist on the object or the value of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> is an empty string (""), the results of the object's `ToString` method are displayed instead.
If the new display member cannot be set, the previous display member setting is maintained.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> specifying the name of an object property that is contained in the collection specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource"></xref> property.
The default is an empty string ("").
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Returns the current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item, if it is a property of an object given the item and the property name.
The object the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item is bound to.
The property name of the item the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> is bound to.
The filtered object.
Retrieves the current value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item, if it is a property of an object, given the item.
The object the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref> item is bound to.
The filtered object.
Occurs when the control is bound to a data value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format> event is raised before each visible item in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl> is formatted.

Handling this event gives you access to the string to be displayed for this list item, through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ConvertEventArgs.Value%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControlConvertEventArgs>.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> that provides custom formatting behavior.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatInfo%2A> property will override the default formatting behavior, which uses the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Application.CurrentCulture%2A> setting.
The <xref href="System.IFormatProvider"></xref> implementation that provides custom formatting behavior.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatInfo"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Gets or sets the format-specifier characters that indicate how a value is to be displayed.
The format string used must follow standard [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)] format specifications.
For more information, see [Formatting Types in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md).
The string of format-specifier characters that indicates how a value is to be displayed.
Occurs when value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatString"></xref> property changes
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).

Gets or sets a value indicating whether formatting is applied to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> property to `true` causes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format> event to be raised for each visible member of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl>.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> are related as follows:

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.
`true` if formatting of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember"></xref> property is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Occurs when the value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
Returns the text representation of the specified item.
The object from which to get the contents to display.

If the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember"></xref> property is not specified, the value returned by <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.GetItemText(System.Object)"></xref> is the value of the item's `ToString` method.
Otherwise, the method returns the string value of the member specified in the property for the object specified in the item parameter.
Handles special input keys, such as PAGE UP, PAGE DOWN, HOME, END, and so on.
One of the values of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref>.
`true` if the keyData parameter specifies the , , , or key; `false` if the keyData parameter specifies .
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.BindingContextChanged"></xref> event.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSourceChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnDataSourceChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMemberChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnDisplayMemberChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.Format"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnFormat%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControlConvertEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatInfoChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnFormatInfoChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormatStringChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnFormatStringChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabledChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnFormattingEnabledChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged"></xref> event.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMemberChanged"></xref> event.
Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate.
For more information, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.OnValueMemberChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate.
This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the data of the object at the specified index with the contents of the data source.
The zero-based index of the item whose data to refresh.
When overridden in a derived class, resynchronizes the item data with the contents of the data source.
When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the zero-based index of the currently selected item.
A zero-based index of the currently selected item.
A value of negative one (-1) is returned if no item is selected.
Gets or sets the value of the member property specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember"></xref> property.

If a property is not specified in <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> returns the results of the `ToString` method of the object.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> are related as follows:

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `false`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will not be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.FormattingEnabled%2A> is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> will be set to -1 when <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> is blank.
An object containing the value of the member of the data source specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember"></xref> property.
The assigned value is `null` or the empty string ("").
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
When overridden in a derived class, sets the object with the specified index in the derived class.
The array index of the object.
The object.
When overridden in a derived class, sets the specified array of objects in a collection in the derived class.
An array of items.
Gets or sets the path of the property to use as the actual value for the items in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl"></xref>.
Specify the contents of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property in cases where you bind data.
You can clear the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property by setting the property to an empty string ("") or `null`.

Setting a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A> property raises the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMemberChanged> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValueChanged> events.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> representing a single property name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource"></xref> property value, or a hierarchy of period-delimited property names that resolves to a property name of the final data-bound object.
The default is an empty string ("").
The specified property path cannot be resolved through the object specified by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DataSource"></xref> property.
Occurs when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember"></xref> property changes.
For more information about handling events, see [Handling and Raising Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/b6f65241-e0ad-4590-a99f-200ce741bb1f).
